metadata.Title: CVE-2019-13715 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Insufficient validation of untrusted input in Omnibox in Google Chrome prior to 78.0.3904.70 allowed a remote attacker to perform domain spoofing via IDN homographs via a crafted domain name.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-13715` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 78.0.3904.70-0ubuntu0.18.04.2
chromium-browser-l10n - 78.0.3904.70-0ubuntu0.18.04.2
chromium-chromedriver - 78.0.3904.70-0ubuntu0.18.04.2
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 78.0.3904.70-0ubuntu0.18.04.2
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 78.0.3904.70-0ubuntu0.18.04.2
No subscription required

notes.Note: alexmurray> The Debian chromium source package is called chromium-browser in Ubuntu

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '78.0.3904.70-0ubuntu0.18.04.2').
